title.value: Эффективность гербицидов избирательного действия в борьбе с борщевиком Сосновского
Efficiency of selective action herbicides against Heracleum L.

person.name: Yakimovich, E.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied effect of selective herbicides on growth and development of Heracleum Sosnowskyi Manden, selection of effective norms and their application on this basis, the proposal produce more effective ways of dealing with Heracleum Sosnowskyi Manden, which had a minimal effect on the other components of plant cenosis. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2011-2012 in Minsk territory. As a result of realized research there were given the evaluation of herbicides biological efficiency: Lintur, WDG (triasulfuron, 41 g/kg + dicamba, 659 g/kg), Fenizan, AS (chlorosulfuron acid 22.2 g/l and dicamba acid 360 g/l), Ballerina, ES (EHE 2.4-D acid, 410 g/l + florasulam, 7.4 g/l), Dianat, WS (dicamba acid, 480 g/l) and  Lancelot 450, WDG (аminopyralid, 300 g/kg + florasulam, 150 g/kg) against Heracleum Sosnowskyi Manden. The optimum rates of herbicides application were selected providing with the gallant soldier's (Heracleum Sosnowskyi Manden) vegetative weight decreased for 88.2-98.3%. One of the advantages of the given herbicides was that they were selective in relation to gramineous plants.
